title: WCAS PHIL 262-0-20 Ethical Problems and Public Issues

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: An analysis of ethical issues that arise in relation to a variety of controversial public issues such as the death penalty, abortion, euthanasia, sexual morality, pornography and censorship, preferential treatment and affirmative action, economic justice and welfare, and the environment and world hunger.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To develop insight into and appreciation for the way philosophical analysis and argument can contribute to clarifying the ethical issues in complex public policy debates.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two brief essays on assigned topics (60%), final essay exam (25%), and contribution to discussion (15%).
